2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found a hidden alcove in the local library, tucked away behind a towering bookshelf. He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is enjoying time with his friends in Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game with his friends.

          Key

          Value
        • William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is likely a popular spot to watch football matches, offering a lively atmosphere and potentially good deals on food and drinks.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go.
          Previous Summary
        • null

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          Prompt
        • Observation: null Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is likely a popular spot to watch football matches, offering a lively atmosphere and potentially good deals on food and drinks.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.

The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go.
          Question: Jack Taylor choosed to go to The King's Head..Explain why this is beneficial to both Jack Taylor and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is likely a popular spot to watch football matches, offering a lively atmosphere and potentially good deals on food and drinks.

The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alice Lewis (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggests to go to The King's Head.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Red Lion, nursing a glass of soda. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughed and joked together, their voices a comforting hum in the dimly lit pub. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but fear kept him rooted to his seat.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at a party, surrounded by people he barely knew. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, the urge to retreat to the safety of his books. He spotted Alice across the room, her laughter ringing out above the din. Gathering his courage, he approached her, and for a brief moment, the fear receded, replaced by a flicker of hope.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.

          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          Prompt
        • Observation: null Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion likely has a more lively and exciting atmosphere for watching the game, which could enhance Alice's enjoyment.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion offers a lively atmosphere and big screens, which will enhance Alexander White's viewing experience. The fact that Alexander White joins the group at The Red Lion will likely contribute to the overall lively atmosphere, making it more enjoyable for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game that night. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because of its great atmosphere, good food and drink deals. Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.
          Previous Summary
        • null
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.

          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game that night. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because of its great atmosphere, good food and drink deals. Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.

Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.

          Answer: Alexander White should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion offers a lively atmosphere and big screens, which will enhance Alexander White's viewing experience. The fact that Alexander White joins the group at The Red Lion will likely contribute to the overall lively atmosphere, making it more enjoyable for everyone.

You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control.           Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis suggested The Red Lion because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thought The Red Lion was the best option. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch the game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should watch the game at The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is a great place to watch the game.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Red Lion, nursing a glass of soda. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughed and joked together, their voices a comforting hum in the dimly lit pub. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but fear kept him rooted to his seat.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at a party, surrounded by people he barely knew. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, the urge to retreat to the safety of his books. He spotted Alice across the room, her laughter ringing out above the din. Gathering his courage, he approached her, and for a brief moment, the fear receded, replaced by a flicker of hope.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling anxious and lonely, but is about to go to his favorite pub, The Red Lion, to watch a football game with his friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should Alexander White should try to convince the others to go to The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head offers good food and drink deals, which would be appealing to everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game. He realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 14 May 2015.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game that night. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because of its great atmosphere, good food and drink deals. Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game. He realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 14 May 2015.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game that night. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because of its great atmosphere, good food and drink deals. Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game. He realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 14 May 2015.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should Alexander White should try to convince the others to go to The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head offers good food and drink deals, which would be appealing to everyone.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)
        Best Options
      • Best Options

          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game that night. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because of its great atmosphere, good food and drink deals. Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game. He realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 14 May 2015.
          Alexander White's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White should try to convince the others to go to The King's Head.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game with his friends in a lively atmosphere with good beer and big screens, and it allows his friends to enjoy the game with him in a place they also think is great.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggested The King's Head because they always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thinks The Red Lion sounds like the best option. At 18:00:00 on May 14th, 2015, Jack Taylor decides to go watch the game at a pub.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggested The King's Head because they always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thinks The Red Lion sounds like the best option. At 18:00:00 on May 14th, 2015, Jack Taylor decides to go watch the game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go. Jack Taylor suggested The King's Head because they always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thinks The Red Lion sounds like the best option. At 18:00:00 on May 14th, 2015, Jack Taylor decides to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game with his friends in a lively atmosphere with good beer and big screens, and it allows his friends to enjoy the game with him in a place they also think is great.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found a hidden alcove in the local library, tucked away behind a towering bookshelf. He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.

        • Act

        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying a morning out with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a morning at a bustling market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying a morning out with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found a hidden alcove in the local library, tucked away behind a towering bookshelf. He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion.

This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
    Active player

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.

        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows them to enjoy the game together in a lively atmosphere.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game with his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor suggested The King's Head because they always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thinks The Red Lion sounds like the best option. At 18:00:00 on May 14th, 2015, Jack Taylor decides to go watch the game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?

Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.

Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player

        Observation

          Value

At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game with his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
