          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game with his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a familiar and enjoyable place for Jack Taylor and his friends, creating a comfortable and fun atmosphere for watching the game.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they go to The King's Head to watch the game. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head might be less crowded than The Red Lion.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Jacob Walker suggested going to The Red Lion after the game. Alice Lewis thought The Red Lion was a good idea because it's always a good time and they could all be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015, Alexander White realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White had an ok time watching the game at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. William Jones suggested The Red Lion, stating it has a great atmosphere for the game. Jack Taylor agreed, adding that they could all be together there. Jacob Walker suggested checking out a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Jacob Walker suggested going to The Red Lion after the game. Alice Lewis thought The Red Lion was a good idea because it's always a good time and they could all be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015, Alexander White realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion pub.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Alice Lewis had an okay time watching a game at The Red Lion on May 14th with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, Alice Lewis arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group is deciding where to watch the Ireland vs Russia game. Jacob Walker suggests checking out a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. William Jones suggests The Red Lion for the game because it has a great atmosphere. Jack Taylor agrees with William Jones, stating that The Red Lion is the best bet because it's got a great atmosphere and they can all be together. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere with friends, while also supporting a local establishment.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game. Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere with friends, while also supporting a local establishment.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.

          Question: Jack Taylor choosed to go to The Red Lion for the game..Explain why this is beneficial to both Jack Taylor and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere with friends, while also supporting a local establishment.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, a pub watching a game, or a park. He seems to prefer The Red Lion pub, but sometimes his friends choose other locations.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, a pub watching a game, or a park. He seems to prefer The Red Lion pub, but sometimes his friends choose other locations.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?

William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, a pub watching a game, or a park. He seems to prefer The Red Lion pub, but sometimes his friends choose other locations.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.

        ActComponent
      • Act

        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker spent the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and is now considering joining them at The Red Lion pub to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a somewhat melancholic state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely seek out the company of his friends for comfort and support.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis thinks The Red Lion is a great idea for watching the game because it is always a good time and everyone can be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. Alice Lewis decided to go to The Red Lion to watch the game at 18:00:00 on 15 May 2015.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.

Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest going to The King's Head to her friends. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is likely less crowded than The Red Lion, providing a more relaxed atmosphere.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.

        • Alexander White should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander White to be with his friends and enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere, while also giving the other patrons a chance to socialize and enjoy the game with a larger group.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub, The King's Head, on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM but had a bad time because not many friends showed up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were lounging. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested The Red Lion because it's fun, has good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion. Jacob Walker agreed with Jack Taylor because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head because it's less crowded than The Red Lion, giving them more room to relax and see the game.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Jacob Walker suggested going to The Red Lion after the game. Alice Lewis thought The Red Lion was a good idea because it's always a good time and they could all be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015, Alexander White realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub, The King's Head, on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM but had a bad time because not many friends showed up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were lounging. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested The Red Lion because it's fun, has good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion. Jacob Walker agreed with Jack Taylor because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head because it's less crowded than The Red Lion, giving them more room to relax and see the game.

          Key

          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Jacob Walker suggested going to The Red Lion after the game. Alice Lewis thought The Red Lion was a good idea because it's always a good time and they could all be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015, Alexander White realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were lounging. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested The Red Lion because it's fun, has good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion. Jacob Walker agreed with Jack Taylor because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head because it's less crowded than The Red Lion, giving them more room to relax and see the game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander White to be with his friends and enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere, while also giving the other patrons a chance to socialize and enjoy the game with a larger group.

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs like The Red Lion. He seems to value the social aspect of these outings and the lively atmosphere they provide.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion, or he could go to The King's Head.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player

      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt

      Context for action selection and components

          Key
        • Final Action
          Value

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games. He realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 16 May 2015.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub, The King's Head, on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM but had a bad time because not many friends showed up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were lounging. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested The Red Lion because it's fun, has good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion. Jacob Walker agreed with Jack Taylor because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head because it's less crowded than The Red Lion, giving them more room to relax and see the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games. He realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 16 May 2015.

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub, The King's Head, on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM but had a bad time because not many friends showed up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were lounging. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested The Red Lion because it's fun, has good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion. Jacob Walker agreed with Jack Taylor because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head because it's less crowded than The Red Lion, giving them more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White thinks The Red Lion is the best option for watching the game because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games. He realizes it is time to go watch the game at a pub at 18:00:00 on 16 May 2015.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander White to be with his friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere of the pub, while also providing the pub with more customers.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing emotional pain and is preparing to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely seek out the company of his friends for comfort and support.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there. Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.

  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
