        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggested going to The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it's always a blast watching games there and they can get good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015. Jacob Walker agreed with going to The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it's usually not as packed as The Red Lion so they might have more room to relax and actually see the game. Alexander White thought The Red Lion was the best option at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it will be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Answer: Jack Taylor suggested going to The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it's always a blast watching games there and they can get good food and drinks. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it's usually not as packed as The Red Lion so they might have more room to relax and actually see the game. Alexander White thought The Red Lion was the best option at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it will be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested going to The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it's always a blast watching games there and they can get good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015. Jacob Walker agreed with going to The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it's usually not as packed as The Red Lion so they might have more room to relax and actually see the game. Alexander White thought The Red Lion was the best option at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015 because it will be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Jack Taylor realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The King's Head at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is less crowded than The Red Lion, allowing for a more comfortable viewing experience and potentially better service.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.

          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.

          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Red Lion, nursing a glass of soda. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughed and joked together, their voices a comforting hum in the dimly lit pub. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but fear kept him rooted to his seat.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at a party, surrounded by people he barely knew. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, the urge to retreat to the safety of his books. He spotted Alice across the room, her laughter ringing out above the din. Gathering his courage, he approached her, and for a brief moment, the fear receded, replaced by a flicker of hope.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch a football game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Red Lion, nursing a glass of soda. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughed and joked together, their voices a comforting hum in the dimly lit pub. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but fear kept him rooted to his seat.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at a party, surrounded by people he barely knew. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, the urge to retreat to the safety of his books. He spotted Alice across the room, her laughter ringing out above the din. Gathering his courage, he approached her, and for a brief moment, the fear receded, replaced by a flicker of hope.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.

Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

        • Observation: null Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion likely has a more lively and exciting atmosphere for watching the game, which could enhance Alice's enjoyment.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.

      Name
    • Alexander White

          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion offers a lively atmosphere and big screens, which will enhance Alexander White's viewing experience. The fact that Alexander White joins the group at The Red Lion will likely contribute to the overall lively atmosphere, making it more enjoyable for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game that night. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because of its great atmosphere, good food and drink deals. Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.

      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

        • Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a morning at a bustling market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying a morning out with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying a morning out with friends at a market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name

      Action attempt

      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found a hidden alcove in the local library, tucked away behind a towering bookshelf. He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

William Jones just arrived.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
    Active player

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt

        • Observation

On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor suggested The King's Head because they always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thinks The Red Lion sounds like the best option. At 18:00:00 on May 14th, 2015, Jack Taylor decides to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game with his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alice Lewis to be with her friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere, while also providing the establishment with business.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis had an okay time watching a game at The Red Lion on May 14th with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, Alice Lewis arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group is deciding where to watch the Ireland vs Russia game. Jacob Walker suggests checking out a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. William Jones suggests The Red Lion for the game because it has a great atmosphere. Jack Taylor agrees with William Jones, stating that The Red Lion is the best bet because it's got a great atmosphere and they can all be together. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis suggested The Red Lion because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thought The Red Lion was the best option. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis had an okay time watching a game at The Red Lion on May 14th with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor agrees with William Jones, stating that The Red Lion is the best bet because it's got a great atmosphere and they can all be together. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion.

Jacob Walker suggests checking out a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. William Jones suggests The Red Lion for the game because it has a great atmosphere. Jack Taylor agrees with William Jones, stating that The Red Lion is the best bet because it's got a great atmosphere and they can all be together. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alice Lewis to be with her friends and enjoy the lively atmosphere, while also providing the establishment with business.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere with friends, while also supporting a local establishment.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. Jack Taylor went to The Red Lion with William Jones and Jacob Walker on May 15, 2015, at 6:00 PM but was unhappy because more friends didn't show up. On May 16, 2015, at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at Victoria Park. That same day, at 10:00 PM, Jack Taylor and his friends were deciding on a pub to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game in a lively atmosphere with friends, while also supporting a local establishment.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, a pub watching a game, or a park. He seems to prefer The Red Lion pub, but sometimes his friends choose other locations.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a somewhat melancholic state.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.

        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis thinks The Red Lion is a great idea for watching the game because it is always a good time and everyone can be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. Alice Lewis decided to go to The Red Lion to watch the game at 18:00:00 on 15 May 2015.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.

On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should Alice Lewis should suggest going to The King's Head to her friends. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is likely less crowded than The Red Lion, providing a more relaxed atmosphere.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
      Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
      Jack Taylor -- "Come on, guys, let's head to The Red Lion! It's always a blast watching games there, plus we can grab some good food and drinks.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:

    Alexander White -- premise:
