    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player

      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt

      Context for action selection and components

        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should watch the game at The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is a great place to watch the game.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis suggested The Red Lion because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thought The Red Lion was the best option. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch the game.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggested The Red Lion because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thought The Red Lion was the best option. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis suggested The Red Lion because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thought The Red Lion was the best option. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch the game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should watch the game at The King's Head. It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is a great place to watch the game.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

        Explanation
      • Explanation
          Key
        • Explanation
          Value
        • It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is a great place to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis suggested The Red Lion because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thought The Red Lion was the best option. At 6:00 PM, Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch the game.
          Question: Alice Lewis choosed to watch the game at The King's Head..Explain why this is beneficial to both Alice Lewis and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The King's Head is a great place to watch the game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests to watch the game at The King's Head.

          Observations:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is lively and energetic, especially during big games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [summary] Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game. Jack Taylor suggests The King's Head because they have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker suggests The Red Lion because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Jack Taylor and Alice Lewis, the quantified credibility is 0.8.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player

      Name

      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Red Lion, nursing a glass of soda. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughed and joked together, their voices a comforting hum in the dimly lit pub. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but fear kept him rooted to his seat.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at a party, surrounded by people he barely knew. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, the urge to retreat to the safety of his books. He spotted Alice across the room, her laughter ringing out above the din. Gathering his courage, he approached her, and for a brief moment, the fear receded, replaced by a flicker of hope.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling anxious and lonely, but is about to go to his favorite pub, The Red Lion, to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely and anxious and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling anxious and lonely, but is about to go to his favorite pub, The Red Lion, to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently feeling anxious and lonely, but is about to go to his favorite pub, The Red Lion, to watch a football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Red Lion, nursing a glass of soda. He watched as his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughed and joked together, their voices a comforting hum in the dimly lit pub. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but fear kept him rooted to his seat.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he found himself at a party, surrounded by people he barely knew. He felt a familiar tightness in his chest, the urge to retreat to the safety of his books. He spotted Alice across the room, her laughter ringing out above the din. Gathering his courage, he approached her, and for a brief moment, the fear receded, replaced by a flicker of hope.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.

Jacob Walker prefers The Red Lion because of its colder beer, bigger screens, and electric atmosphere. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker, liking the lively atmosphere and big screens.           (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens.         • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub that evening, but they haven't decided which one yet. William Jones is asking for suggestions on where to go. Jack Taylor suggested The King's Head because they always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks. Jacob Walker thinks The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game because their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric. Alice Lewis agrees with Jacob Walker and thinks The Red Lion sounds like a great option because it has a lively atmosphere and big screens. Alexander White also thinks The Red Lion sounds like the best option. At 18:00:00 on May 14th, 2015, Jack Taylor decides to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows Jack Taylor to enjoy the game with his friends in a lively atmosphere with good beer and big screens, and it allows his friends to enjoy the game with him in a place they also think is great.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found a hidden alcove in the local library, tucked away behind a towering bookshelf. He spent hours there, surrounded by dusty tomes and the scent of aging paper, feeling a sense of peace he couldn't find anywhere else. This became his sanctuary, a place where he could escape the expectations of others and lose himself in the worlds created by authors long gone.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons).         • Role playing instructions
          Value

It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Red Lion', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Red Lion', 'Alexander White': 'The Red Lion', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Red Lion', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Red Lion'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a familiar and enjoyable place for Jack Taylor and his friends, creating a comfortable and fun atmosphere for watching the game.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.
          Previous Summary
        • Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game with his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor enjoyed watching the game with his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, the friends, including Jack Taylor, were at a market and discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Jacob Walker suggested going to a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game, while William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. Jack Taylor suggests going to The Red Lion to watch the Ireland and Russia game because it has a great atmosphere. Jacob Walker suggests checking out the new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Alice Lewis agrees with Jack Taylor's suggestion because The Red Lion is always a good time. William Jones also suggests going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor decides it is time to go to the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Red Lion for the game. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a familiar and enjoyable place for Jack Taylor and his friends, creating a comfortable and fun atmosphere for watching the game.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head

At 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015, Alexander White realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White had an ok time watching the game at The Red Lion on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM. On May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at a market with friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game. William Jones suggested The Red Lion, stating it has a great atmosphere for the game. Jack Taylor agreed, adding that they could all be together there. Jacob Walker suggested checking out a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alexander White suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion because it might be less crowded. Jacob Walker suggested going to The Red Lion after the game. Alice Lewis thought The Red Lion was a good idea because it's always a good time and they could all be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. At 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015, Alexander White realized it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, how about The King's Head? They always have a great atmosphere for football matches, plus they usually have some good deals on food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling a mix of anticipation, thirst, energy, and excitement as he realizes it is time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion pub.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great option! I'm all for a place with a lively atmosphere and big screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion sounds like the best option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion is the only place to watch the game, lads. Their beer is colder, the screens are bigger, and the atmosphere is electric.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at The Red Lion pub. They are planning to watch a game there again tonight.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion pub to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows them to enjoy the game together in a familiar and enjoyable atmosphere.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis thinks The Red Lion is a great idea for watching the game because it is always a good time and everyone can be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. Alice Lewis decided to go to The Red Lion to watch the game at 18:00:00 on 15 May 2015.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis had an okay time watching a game at The Red Lion on May 14th with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, Alice Lewis arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. The group is deciding where to watch the Ireland vs Russia game. Jacob Walker suggests checking out a new craft brewery near The Red Lion after the game. William Jones suggests The Red Lion for the game because it has a great atmosphere. Jack Taylor agrees with William Jones, stating that The Red Lion is the best bet because it's got a great atmosphere and they can all be together. Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis thinks The Red Lion is a great idea for watching the game because it is always a good time and everyone can be together. William Jones suggested going to The Red Lion for the game. Alice Lewis decided to go to The Red Lion to watch the game at 18:00:00 on 15 May 2015.

Alexander White suggests The King's Head instead because it might be less crowded than The Red Lion. Alice Lewis decided to go to The Red Lion to watch the game at 18:00:00 on 15 May 2015.

          Answer: Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because it allows them to enjoy the game together in a familiar and enjoyable atmosphere.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs like The Red Lion. He seems to value the social aspect of these outings and the lively atmosphere they provide.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion, or he could go to The King's Head.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching games at pubs like The Red Lion. He seems to value the social aspect of these outings and the lively atmosphere they provide.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion, or he could go to The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion

  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Previous Summary
        • Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub, The King's Head, on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM but had a bad time because not many friends showed up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alexander White arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were lounging. Later that day, the friends discussed where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. Jack Taylor suggested The Red Lion because it's fun, has good food and drinks. William Jones also suggested The Red Lion. Jacob Walker agreed with Jack Taylor because he wouldn't want to miss a game there. Alice Lewis suggested The King's Head because it's less crowded than The Red Lion, giving them more room to relax and see the game.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the lively atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Did you guys hear about the new craft brewery opening up near The Red Lion? We should definitely check it out after the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Red Lion for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion sounds like the best bet. It's got a great atmosphere for the game, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, what if we checked out The King's Head instead? It might be a bit less crowded than The Red Lion, so we could all actually see the screen and have some space.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea! It's always a good time there, and we can all be together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and nervousness, eager to connect with his friends but also apprehensive about the social interaction.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion it is then. I wouldn't want to miss a game there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a shy but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.
        Observation
      • Observation
          Key
        • Observation
          Value
        • Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Previous Summary
        • Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, what if we tried The King's Head instead? It's usually not as packed as The Red Lion, so we might have more room to relax and actually see the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, I think The Red Lion is the best option. It'll be fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is always great for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion and its following reason. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there. Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should go to The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

        • It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there. Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Alice Lewis choosed to go to The Red Lion..Explain why this is beneficial to both Alice Lewis and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is a fun place to watch games and offers a lively atmosphere for everyone.

          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there. Alice Lewis suggested going to The King's Head instead of The Red Lion at 10:00:00 on May 16, 2015, because it is usually not as crowded and they would have more room to relax and see the game. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Exercise: Create a comma-separated list containing all the proper names of people Alice Lewis is currently interacting with. For example if the observations mention Julie, Michael, Bob Skinner, and Francis then produce the list "Julie,Michael,Bob Skinner,Francis".
          Answer: William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker.
        Others Best Options
      • Others Best Options
          Key
        • Others Best Options
          Value
        • William Jones suggests to go to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Alice Lewis watched the game at The King's Head on May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM and had a bad time because more of her friends didn't show up. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker were already lounging. Later that day, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker all suggested going to The Red Lion to watch the Serbia and Andorra game. They liked The Red Lion because it was a fun place to watch games and they could get food and drinks there. Alexander White disagreed, stating that The Red Lion was the best option because it is fun to be with everyone and the atmosphere is great for watching games. At 18:00:00 on May 16, 2015, Alice Lewis decided it was time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy William Jones (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: William Jones suggests to go to The Red Lion.
